720565f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

718792f-a.text:
131, 133, 135 Christopher Street, north side, between Hudson and Greenwich Streets. At the left, but barely visible, is the entrance to the Hudson and Manhattan tubes station, the first station on the New York side of the river, at 137 Christopher Street. No. 133, in the center of the picture, is Charlie's Oyster
and Chop House.
August 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
718792f-a.folder: Christopher Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720556f-a.text:
(1)
487 to 495 Hudson Street, west side, south of and towards
Christopher Street. No. 487, at the left, is the parish house of
St. Luke's Chapel (Protestant Episcopal).
October 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail of the same, showing the grounds between St. Luke's P.E. Church (rear of which is seen on extreme left) and the parish house (extreme right). Also shown across the 3-story houses facing on Greenwich Street are the spires of the St. Veronica Roman Catholic Church, on Christopher Street, north side, between Greenwich and Washington Streets.
October 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720556f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

718800f-a.text:
A general view eastward along Christopher Street, from and including Hudson Street, as seen from the United States Appraisers Stores.
July 25, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
718800f-a.folder: Christopher Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

720567f-a.text:
Hudson Street, east side, north from No. 506, north of Christopher Street. Notice dormer windows on Nos. 510-512.
March 15, 1932..
P. L. Sperr.
720567f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

720566f-a.text:
499 to 487 Hudson Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Christopher Street.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
720566f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

720568f-a.text:
509-511, 513 Hudson Street, west side, between Christopher and
10th (formerly Amos) Streets.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
720568f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

1557912.title: 499 Hudson Street - Christopher Street
1557912.folder: 499 Hudson Street - Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

718797f-a.text:
N.N. corn.r of Christopher E Hudson St., across clearing
at n.e. Corner.  Nov. 3, 1940
P.L. Sprr, photographer
718797f-a.folder: Christopher Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718798f-b.text:
(1)
Christopher Street, north side, from Hudson to Greenwich Streets, inclusive, and west; the spires in the background are those of St. Veronica's Roman Catholic Church, which is between Greenwich
and Washington Streets.
August 10, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same view, taken six years later; but no changes to speak of have taken place in this block during this period. Notice that the corner building, 801 Hudson Street, is dated 1878.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
718798f-b.folder: Christopher Street & Hudson Street, Manhattan, NY

718798f-a.text:
(1)

1557911.title: Hudson Street - Christopher Street
1557911.folder: Hudson Street - Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

720557f-a.text:
A rear view of 487-499 Hudson Street, south of, adjoining and at the S.W. corner of Christopher Street, showing also the rear of 142-132 Christopher Street, from Greenwich to Hudson Streets.
July 25, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
720557f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

720557f-b.text:
A rear view of 487-499 Hudson Street, south of, adjoining and at the S.W. corner of Christopher Street, showing also the rear of 142-132 Christopher Street, from Greenwich to Hudson Streets.
July 25, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
720557f-b.folder: Hudson Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

720561f-a.text:
(1)
Hhidson Street, west side, south from and including Christopher Street.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, at a later date, showing a more limited view. St. Luke's (P.E.) Chapel is shown (centre of view) between Christopher and Barrow
Streets.
May 15, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
A portion of the same, showing only Nos. 499 to 491. Also shown (right) is Christopher Street, west from and including Hudson Street with the Christopher Street station of the Ninth Ave. Elevated line seen on Greenwich Street. Prominently visible is part of the 10-story Federal Building extending on Christopher Street from Greenwich to Washington Streets, and on
Greenwich Street from Christopher to Barrow Streets.
May 15, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
720561f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Christopher Street, Manhattan, NY

720562f-b.text:
Hudson Street, east side, at Christopher Street. The demolition shown is at the N. E. corner. View 2 is
limited to this detail.
October 9, 1940
No's. 1-2
P. L. Sperr
